Sentencas: Planar solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs), which are intended to be used in the intermediate temperature range (600-800 degrees C) and whose supporting anode contains various amount of Cu in Li-doped gadolinia-doped ceria matrix, are produced and characterized in the present work.
Titulo: Influence of Copper-based Anode Composition on Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance

Sentencas: Intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell (IT-SOFC) performances are investigated by recording polarization and power density at different temperatures.
Titulo: Influence of Copper-based Anode Composition on Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) measurements are carried out to analyze how internal resistances change as function of temperature and, above all, for variable Cu content.
Titulo: Influence of Copper-based Anode Composition on Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance

Sentencas: The gadolinia-doped ceria electrolyte microstructure and the cell integrity after sintering are also shown to depend on the initial CuO content in the anode.
Titulo: Influence of Copper-based Anode Composition on Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance

Sentencas: The electronic conductivity increases with Cu content within the anodic cermet.
Titulo: Influence of Copper-based Anode Composition on Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance

Sentencas: When the anode contains more than 25vol.% CuO, a dense Li-doped gadolinia-doped ceria electrolyte can be obtained by sintering at 900 degrees C. Conversely, CuO load in excess to 50% in the anode is detrimental because of the formation of macroscopic cracks within the electrolyte.
Titulo: Influence of Copper-based Anode Composition on Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance

Sentencas: Intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells produced with an anodic layer containing 50 vol.% CuO show the lowest impedance parameters.
Titulo: Influence of Copper-based Anode Composition on Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance
